question.body: A jogger may experience more bursitis in their knees but a pitcher may experience more bursitis in their shoulder. Which of the following would explain this difference?

multiple_choice.choice: Joggers have a lot of mechanical stress on their shoulders and pitchers have a lot of mechanical stress on their knees
Joggers have a lot of mechanical stress on their knees and pitchers have a lot of mechanical stress on their shoulders.
This infection occurs at joints that do not have a lot of stress placed on them.
There should not be a difference in where the bursitis occurs.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Joggers have a lot of mechanical stress on their knees.
Correct. Your knees are under a lot of mechanical stress as a jogger and as a pitcher your shoulder is under a lot of stress. This mechanical stress can cause inflammation of the bursae.
Incorrect. Bursitis is an inflammation not necessarily an infection.
Incorrect. Bursitis occurs at joints that are under a lot of mechanical stress.

part.hint: -itis indicates “inflammation” and can be caused by stress.
